intro: Bulbophyllum constrictilabre, commonly known as the narrow-lipped bulbophyllum, is a species of orchid native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its sympodial growth habit and produces pseudobulbs that store water and nutrients. The plant features long, narrow leaves and produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated by orchid enthusiasts.
